original: @153a # // 'phags pa kun nas sgor 'jug pa'i 'od zer gtsug tor dri ma med par snang ba'i gzungs bklag cing mchod rten brgya rtsa brgyad dam /
analyzed: @153a # // 'phags pa kun nas sgor 'jug pa'i 'od zer gtsug tor dri ma med par snang ba'i gzungs bklag cing mchod rten brgya rtsa brgyad dam /
translated: The noble Dhāraṇī of the Light of the Stainless Topknot, which is the Light Ray Entering from All Directions, is recited, and one hundred eight stūpas or

original: mchod rten lnga gdab pa'i cho ga mdo snge las bsdus pa /
analyzed: mchod rten lnga gdab pa'i cho ga mdo snge las bsdus pa /
translated: five stūpas are erected.

original: gtsug tor dri ma med par snang ba yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che'i gzungs bzlas shing mchod rten gdab pa'i thabs la der gtogs pa thams cad phyi'i khrus kyang bya /
analyzed: gtsug tor dri ma med par snang ba yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che'i gzungs bzlas shing mchod rten gdab pa'i thabs la der gtogs pa thams cad phyi'i khrus kyang bya /
translated: The method of reciting the Dhāraṇī of the Stainless Topknot, the Wish-Fulfilling Jewel, and the method of erecting stūpas, all the activities included there, and the external ablutions are performed.

original: mgo mjug kun du gnod sems dang / brnab sems dang / ma dad pa dang / le lo dang / gnyid la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i skyon dang / sems ma 'dres par bsdams shing gnod pa dang 'tshe ba'i las ma shor bar bya /
analyzed: mgo mjug kun du gnod sems dang / brnab sems dang / ma dad pa dang / le lo dang / gnyid la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i skyon dang / sems ma 'dres par bsdams shing gnod pa dang 'tshe ba'i las ma shor bar bya /
translated: Throughout the beginning and end, one should be restrained with a mind free from the faults of afflictions such as malice, covetousness, lack of faith, laziness, sleep, and so forth, and one should not engage in harmful or injurious actions.

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi yon tan gyi mthu'i khyad par dang / mdo sde'i phan yon la yid ches pa dang / dad cing gus pa cher bskyed /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi yon tan gyi mthu'i khyad par dang / mdo sde'i phan yon la yid ches pa dang / dad cing gus pa cher bskyed /
translated: One should greatly generate faith and respect, confidence in the special power of the qualities of the Three Jewels and the benefits of the sūtras.

original: sems can thams cad la byams pa dang snying rje cher bskyed do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la byams pa dang snying rje cher bskyed do //
translated: Generate great love and compassion for all sentient beings.

original: khyim pa zhig na bsnyen gnas kyi khrims bzung la /
analyzed: khyim pa zhig na bsnyen gnas kyi khrims bzung la /
translated: If you are a layperson, take the one-day precepts.

original: de nas mchod rten gdab pa'i yo byad rnams bshams la /
analyzed: de nas mchod rten gdab pa'i yo byad rnams bshams la /
translated: Then, set out the materials for casting the stūpa.

original: 'jim pa brko ba nas btab cing dkyil 'khor @153b du bzhugs pa'i bar du mchod rten gyi cho ga bzhin du nang par snga dro thebs par bya /
analyzed: 'jim pa brko ba nas btab cing dkyil 'khor @153b du bzhugs pa'i bar du mchod rten gyi cho ga bzhin du nang par snga dro thebs par bya /
translated: From digging the clay up to casting the stūpa, do everything according to the stūpa ritual.

original: mchod pa'i cho ga dang yo byad bshams pa yan chad legs par bgyi /
analyzed: mchod pa'i cho ga dang yo byad bshams pa yan chad legs par bgyi /
translated: Do everything up to setting out the offering ritual and materials.

original: mchod rten 'debs pa'i zla ba la chos kyi spyin pa dang / 'phags pa rnams kyi thugs dam bskul bar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ; gser 'od dam pa dang / rin po che'i tog dang / gtsug na rin po che dang /
analyzed: mchod rten 'debs pa'i zla ba la chos kyi spyin pa dang / 'phags pa rnams kyi thugs dam bskul bar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ; gser 'od dam pa dang / rin po che'i tog dang / gtsug na rin po che dang /
translated: In the month of casting the stūpa, give the gift of Dharma, and recite the Perfection of Wisdom, the Golden Light, the Jewel Topknot, the Crown Jewel, and the Sūtra of the Precious Lamp.

original: gtsug tor dri ma med pa'i gzungs kyi mdo sde tshar phyin rgyun mi 'chad par bklag / yid bzhin nor bu'i gzungs rnam gnyis kyi 'dzab grva gcig kyang bzlas /
analyzed: gtsug tor dri ma med pa'i gzungs kyi mdo sde tshar phyin rgyun mi 'chad par bklag / yid bzhin nor bu'i gzungs rnam gnyis kyi 'dzab grva gcig kyang bzlas /
translated: One should recite the two-part Dhâranî of the Wish-fulfilling Gem in one corner.

original: mdo sde dag kyang mchod cing chos kyi sbyin pa bsngo ba dang / spyan drang ba la sogs pa sna la bgyis nas bklag go //
analyzed: mdo sde dag kyang mchod cing chos kyi sbyin pa bsngo ba dang / spyan drang ba la sogs pa sna la bgyis nas bklag go //
translated: One should read the sutras after having made offerings to them and dedicated the gift of the Dharma and invited the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: mdo sde de snyed ma lhogs na yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang gzungs tshar gang byung zhig bton pa'i 'og tu snying po bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde de snyed ma lhogs na yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang gzungs tshar gang byung zhig bton pa'i 'og tu snying po bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Even if one does not read all of the sutras, one should recite the Heart of the Perfection of Wisdom and the Dhâranî as much as one can, and then recite the essence mantras.

original: de nas mchod rten thebs /
analyzed: de nas mchod rten thebs /
translated: Then one should build the stupa.

original: mchod pa bshams /
analyzed: mchod pa bshams /
translated: One should set out the offerings.

original: gsung rab rdzogs nas bar skabs der cung zhig bsangs te /
analyzed: gsung rab rdzogs nas bar skabs der cung zhig bsangs te /
translated: After completing the recitation of the scriptures, one should rest for a while.

original: de nas snga dro dge 'dun spyir tshogs nas mchod pa la sogs pa rim bzhin bgyi'o //
analyzed: de nas snga dro dge 'dun spyir tshogs nas mchod pa la sogs pa rim bzhin bgyi'o //
translated: Then in the morning, after the assembly of the Sangha has gathered, one should perform the offerings and so forth in sequence.

original: mchod pa bshams pa'i thabs 'byor pa'i stobs ci nus pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: mchod pa bshams pa'i thabs 'byor pa'i stobs ci nus pa dang sbyar te /
translated: The method of setting out the offerings should be done with whatever strength of resources one has.

original: spos kyi mandal chen po'i dbus su tshon phye'am /
analyzed: spos kyi mandal chen po'i dbus su tshon phye'am /
translated: In the center of a large incense mandala, draw a palace of the five precious gems using colored sand or flowers.

original: me tog rin po che sna lnga'i pho brang rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa bris pa'i dbus su padma chen po'i steng du mchod rten brgya rtsa brgyad shong ba'i gdan seng ge'i khri la padma bzhag la /
analyzed: me tog rin po che sna lnga'i pho brang rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa bris pa'i dbus su padma chen po'i steng du mchod rten brgya rtsa brgyad shong ba'i gdan seng ge'i khri la padma bzhag la /
translated: In the center of the palace, which is adorned with various ornaments, place a lion throne with a large lotus on top, which can accommodate one hundred and eight stupas.

original: re'u mig chen po brgya dang / ngos bzhi'i dbus su re'u gnyis gnyis su bgyi ste /
analyzed: re'u mig chen po brgya dang / ngos bzhi'i dbus su re'u gnyis gnyis su bgyi ste /
translated: In the center of the palace, make a large grid of one hundred squares, and in the center of each of the four sides, make two squares each.

original: brgya rtsa brgyad bshams pa'am /
analyzed: brgya rtsa brgyad bshams pa'am /
translated: Thus, you should arrange one hundred and eight stupas.

original: mchod rten lnga pa zhig na 'tsham par sbyar te de la bzhugs su gsol /
analyzed: mchod rten lnga pa zhig na 'tsham par sbyar te de la bzhugs su gsol /
translated: Or, if you have five stupas, you should arrange them in a suitable way.

original: ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten gcig kyang dbus su bzhugs /
analyzed: ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten gcig kyang dbus su bzhugs /
translated: Place one stupa with relics in the center.

original: bar gyi snam bu gcig gam gnyis la padma mang po dgram shing 'phags pa gdan 'dzom pa'i gdan du bsham zhing /
analyzed: bar gyi snam bu gcig gam gnyis la padma mang po dgram shing 'phags pa gdan 'dzom pa'i gdan du bsham zhing /
translated: On one or two intermediate platforms, arrange many lotuses and set up seats for the assembly of noble ones.

original: gzungs chab kyi bum pa kha rgyan can bzhi yan chad du 'byor pa ngos bzhir bzhag ;
analyzed: gzungs chab kyi bum pa kha rgyan can bzhi yan chad du 'byor pa ngos bzhir bzhag ;
translated: Place four or more vases for the dhāraṇī water on the four sides.

original: de'i phyi rol gar 'os par bshos dang / mchod yon la sogs pa mchod pa rgyas par dgram /
analyzed: de'i phyi rol gar 'os par bshos dang / mchod yon la sogs pa mchod pa rgyas par dgram /
translated: Outside of that, arrange the offerings as much as is appropriate, such as the bali offerings, water for drinking and water for bathing, and so forth.

original: steng du bla re dang 'phan dang ba dan mang po brgya rtsa brgyad man chad rgyas par dgram /
analyzed: steng du bla re dang 'phan dang ba dan mang po brgya rtsa brgyad man chad rgyas par dgram /
translated: Above, arrange canopies, banners, and flags, up to one hundred and eight.

original: grva bzhir pog phor aa ka ru dang / tu rushka dang / gu gul gyi bdug pas bdug go //
analyzed: grva bzhir pog phor aa ka ru dang / tu rushka dang / gu gul gyi bdug pas bdug go //
translated: In the four corners, burn incense of agaru, turuşka, and gugul.

original: sgo bzhir @154a * //
analyzed: sgo bzhir @154a * //
translated: At the four doors,

original: mchod rten bzhi bsham /
analyzed: mchod rten bzhi bsham /
translated: arrange four stupas.

original: gzhan yang mchod pa ci nus su rgyas par bgyi'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang mchod pa ci nus su rgyas par bgyi'o //
translated: Furthermore, make offerings as much as possible.

original: bum pa'i khar yungs kar dang bye ma yang bzhag cing bzlas la dur khrod dam /
analyzed: bum pa'i khar yungs kar dang bye ma yang bzhag cing bzlas la dur khrod dam /
translated: On top of the vase, place white mustard seeds and sand. Recite [the mantra] and scatter [the mustard seeds and sand] in the charnel grounds

original: phyogs kun du yang gtor ro //
analyzed: phyogs kun du yang gtor ro //
translated: and in all directions.

original: dang por mchod pa bshams la dge 'dun tshogs nas phyogs bcu'i 'phags pa thams cad la phyag bgyi /
analyzed: dang por mchod pa bshams la dge 'dun tshogs nas phyogs bcu'i 'phags pa thams cad la phyag bgyi /
translated: First, arrange the offerings and, after the assembly of the saṅgha, prostrate to all the noble ones of the ten directions.

original: de nas chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin ci nus kyis bsgom /
analyzed: de nas chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin ci nus kyis bsgom /
translated: Then, meditate on the samādhi of emptiness, the nonobservation of all phenomena, as much as possible.

original: ting nge 'dzin las langs nas chos thams cad don dam par de lta bu yin la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las langs nas chos thams cad don dam par de lta bu yin la /
translated: When he rises from that concentration, he thinks, “All phenomena are ultimately like that.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis de kho na nyid thugs su chud pas /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis de kho na nyid thugs su chud pas /
translated: The noble ones have realized thatness.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs nam mkha' dang 'dra bar gyur te /
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs nam mkha' dang 'dra bar gyur te /
translated: Their bodies, speech, and minds are like space.

original: sgrib pa mi mnga' zhing mthu dang byin gyi rlabs bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i go 'phang brnyes pa yang rung na /
analyzed: sgrib pa mi mnga' zhing mthu dang byin gyi rlabs bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i go 'phang brnyes pa yang rung na /
translated: They have attained the state of being free from obscurations, and their powers and blessings are inconceivable.

original: kye ma'o sems can 'di dag ni chos kyi de kho na nyid ma rtogs te rmongs pas nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal mang pos gzir cing nyam thag pa'i gnas su ltung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: kye ma'o sems can 'di dag ni chos kyi de kho na nyid ma rtogs te rmongs pas nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal mang pos gzir cing nyam thag pa'i gnas su ltung bar 'gyur la /
translated: Alas! These sentient beings have not realized the thatness of phenomena. Because of their delusion, they are oppressed by many afflictions and sufferings and fall into miserable realms.

original: sems can thams cad kyang thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba nas 'gro ba brgyud pa rnams su bdag gi gnyen bshes dam ba drin gyi zhing du ma gyur pa gang yang med cing /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba nas 'gro ba brgyud pa rnams su bdag gi gnyen bshes dam ba drin gyi zhing du ma gyur pa gang yang med cing /
translated: Moreover, in the course of beginningless cyclic existence, all sentient beings have been my kind parents in my series of lives as a transmigrating being. There is not a single one who has not been my dearest relative and object of kindness.”

original: bdag gis kyang dang por byang chub kyi sems dam pa bskyed de 'gro ba mang po'i don dpag tu med pa bsgrub par dam bcas pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bdag gis kyang dang por byang chub kyi sems dam pa bskyed de 'gro ba mang po'i don dpag tu med pa bsgrub par dam bcas pa'i tshe /
translated: When I first generated the excellent mind of enlightenment and promised to accomplish the benefit of many transmigrating beings,

original: sems can thams cad bdag gis blangs zin pas /
analyzed: sems can thams cad bdag gis blangs zin pas /
translated: I took up all sentient beings.

original: 'di lta bu la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis yal ba dor ba ni /
analyzed: 'di lta bu la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis yal ba dor ba ni /
translated: It is not right for bodhisattvas to abandon such beings.

original: mi rigs na 'di dag ji ltar sdug bsngal las ni gdon /
analyzed: mi rigs na 'di dag ji ltar sdug bsngal las ni gdon /
translated: How can I lead them away from suffering?🔽How can I establish them in happiness?

original: bde ba la ni ji ltar dgod par bya snyam du snying rje dang / byams pa chen po dang ldan pa'i brtson pa'i sems drag tu bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba la ni ji ltar dgod par bya snyam du snying rje dang / byams pa chen po dang ldan pa'i brtson pa'i sems drag tu bskyed par bya'o //
translated: In this way, you should generate a very powerful mind of striving that is endowed with great compassion and love.

original: yang 'di snyam du bsam ste /
analyzed: yang 'di snyam du bsam ste /
translated: Again, think in this way:

original: bdag ni dus ngan pa'i sems can spyod pa dang mthu dman pa yin pas /
analyzed: bdag ni dus ngan pa'i sems can spyod pa dang mthu dman pa yin pas /
translated: I am a sentient being of a degenerate time, with weak conduct and weak power.

original: bdag nyid gcig pus 'phral du don rlabs po che 'di lta bu mi lcogs kyis /
analyzed: bdag nyid gcig pus 'phral du don rlabs po che 'di lta bu mi lcogs kyis /
translated: I alone cannot immediately accomplish such a great purpose.

original: ston pa bde bar gshegs pas sngon lha'i bu nor bu'i snying po dri ma med pa la rjes su thugs brtse nas kun nas sgor 'jug pa'i 'od zer gtsug tor dri ma med par snang ba de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dam tshig dang snying po la🔽rnam par blta ba'i gzungs la brten te /
analyzed: ston pa bde bar gshegs pas sngon lha'i bu nor bu'i snying po dri ma med pa la rjes su thugs brtse nas kun nas sgor 'jug pa'i 'od zer gtsug tor dri ma med par snang ba de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dam tshig dang snying po la rnam par blta ba'i gzungs la brten te /
translated: based himself on the dharani called the 'Omniscient Light of the Usnisa of the Stainless One, the Tathagata of the Universal Gate',

original: phyogs bcu'i de bzhin @154b gshegs pa sras dang bcas pa dang / dam pa'i chos skyong ba thams cad gdan 'dzom par spyan drangs la mthu bstan pa dang dpung gnyen du gsol te /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i de bzhin @154b gshegs pa sras dang bcas pa dang / dam pa'i chos skyong ba thams cad gdan 'dzom par spyan drangs la mthu bstan pa dang dpung gnyen du gsol te /
translated: and invited all the Tathagatas of the ten directions, together with their sons, and all the protectors of the holy Dharma, to a great assembly. He then revealed his power and asked for their help.

original: de ltar ni 'phags pa'i mthu dang byin gyi rlabs kyis 'gro ba rnams la phan pa bsgrub par byas la /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'phags pa'i mthu dang byin gyi rlabs kyis 'gro ba rnams la phan pa bsgrub par byas la /
translated: In this way, through the noble power and blessing, he accomplished the benefit of beings.

original: phyis ni bdag nyid gcig bus gzhan la ltos pa med par yang thabs mkhas pa'i sgo sna tshogs nas sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba bla na med pa yang dag par bsgrub par bya'o snyam du bsam mo //
analyzed: phyis ni bdag nyid gcig bus gzhan la ltos pa med par yang thabs mkhas pa'i sgo sna tshogs nas sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba bla na med pa yang dag par bsgrub par bya'o snyam du bsam mo //
translated: Later, by myself alone, without relying on others, I will, by various skillful means, perfectly accomplish the unsurpassed benefit and happiness of all sentient beings.

original: de ltar snying rje dang byams pa'i sems bskyed pa'i 'og tu sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir 'phags pa gdan 'dzom pa'i pho brang dang / mchod pa'i tshogs bshams pa bden pa bdar zhing yid kyis bsngo ste /
analyzed: de ltar snying rje dang byams pa'i sems bskyed pa'i 'og tu sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir 'phags pa gdan 'dzom pa'i pho brang dang / mchod pa'i tshogs bshams pa bden pa bdar zhing yid kyis bsngo ste /
translated: In this way, after generating the mind of compassion and love, in order to benefit sentient beings, one should invoke the assembly of noble ones in the palace of the gathering, arrange the collection of offerings, recite the truth, and mentally dedicate.

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi bden pa dang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs dang / tshogs gnyis yongs su rdzogs pa'i mnga' thang chan po dang / chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i stobs kyis /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi bden pa dang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs dang / tshogs gnyis yongs su rdzogs pa'i mnga' thang chan po dang / chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i stobs kyis /
translated: By the truth of the Three Jewels, the blessings of all the buddhas and bodhisattvas, the great power of perfecting the two accumulations, and the inconceivable power of the pure dharmadhatu,

original: deng kun nas sgor 'jug pa'i 'od zer gtsug tor dri ma med par snang ba de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying po dam tshig la rnam par blta ba'i gzungs kyi mdo las 'byung ba'i cho ga bzhin /
analyzed: deng kun nas sgor 'jug pa'i 'od zer gtsug tor dri ma med par snang ba de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying po dam tshig la rnam par blta ba'i gzungs kyi mdo las 'byung ba'i cho ga bzhin /
translated: Now, in accordance with the ritual of the sutra of the dharani called the Light of the Stainless Crown of Radiance Entering All Doors,

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku'i mchod rten brgya rtsa brgyad btab pa'i gnas 'dir phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa sras dang bcas pa dang 'phags pa chos skyong ba thams cad gdan 'dzom pa'i pho brang gi dkyil 'khor dang / mchod pa'i tshogs sbyar ba 'di rnams ji ltar sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis sngon gyi smon lam khyad par can gyis bsgrub pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang /
translated: in this place where one hundred and eight stupas of the dharmakaya of the tathagatas have been erected, may this mandala palace where all the tathagatas of the ten directions, their sons, and all the noble Dharma protectors have assembled, and these offerings be endowed with the qualities of the pure buddhafields of the buddhas and bodhisattvas accomplished through their extraordinary aspirations in the past,

original: bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag tu med pa'i zhing gi bkod pa'i yon tan lta bu dang ldan par gyur te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag tu med pa'i zhing gi bkod pa'i yon tan lta bu dang ldan par gyur te /

analyzed: sa gzhi rin po che sna tshegs kyi rang bzhin lag mthil ltar mnyam pa /

analyzed: tha gru che ba yangs pa reg na 'jam zhing bde ba /
translated: It is vast and spacious, soft and pleasant to the touch.

analyzed: lha'i me tog sna tshogs kyis gcal du bkram pa /
translated: It is strewn with various celestial flowers.

analyzed: mtha' rin po che'i pha gus brtsigs shing /
translated: The edges are built with precious stones.

translated: It is covered with a latticework of gold and pearls.🔽It is covered with swaying and swaying utpala, kumuda,

translated: The five faculties are faith, diligence, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.🔽🔽The five powers are the same as the five faculties, but they are called powers when they become so powerful that nonvirtue cannot overpower them.🔽🔽The seven aspects of enlightenment are the mindfulness of knowing the faults of samsara and the good qualities of nirvana;
